section.name: Related Projects
section.p: Nothing listed here is directly supported by the BSF developers. If you encounter any problems with them, please use the contact information. Failing that, a query to the bsf-users mailing list may help.

subsection.name: BeanShell
subsection.p: "BeanShell is a small, free, embeddable, Java source interpreter with object scripting language features, written in Java. BeanShell executes standard Java statements and expressions, in addition to obvious scripting commands and syntax. BeanShell supports scripted objects as simple method closures like those in Perl and JavaScript(tm)."

tr.td: Dual Licensed: Sun Public License / Gnu Lesser Public License

subsection.name: Rhino
subsection.p: "Rhino is an open-source implementation of JavaScript written entirely in Java. It is typically embedded into Java applications to provide scripting to end users."

subsection.name: Jython
subsection.p: "Jython is an implementation of the high-level, dynamic, object-oriented language Python written in 100% Pure Java, and seamlessly integrated with the Java platform. It thus allows you to run Python on any Java platform."

subsection.name: JPython
subsection.p: "JPython is a new implementation of the Python programming language which is designed to run on SUN's Java(tm) Platform. It consists of a compiler to compile Python source code down to Java bytecodes which can run directly on a JVM, a set of support libraries which are used by the compiled Java bytecodes, and extra support to make it trivial to use Java packages from within JPython."
NOTE: new development has shifted to Jython

tr.td: JPython 1.03, with BSF 2.2 and above (succeeded by Jython)

subsection.name: Jacl
subsection.p: "Jacl, which stands for Java Command Language, is a Java implementation of TCL 8.x."

tr.td: Sun, ORO, and UCB licenses (see source)

subsection.name: NetRexx
subsection.p: "NetRexx is a human-oriented programming language which makes writing and using Java classes quicker and easier than writing in Java."

tr.td: IBM License Agreement for IBM Employee-Written Software

subsection.name: JRuby
subsection.p: "JRuby is a pure Java implementation of the Ruby interpreter, being developed by Jan Arne Petersen and others."

subsection.name: JudoScript
subsection.p: "Judoscript is a 3GL-and-4GL; it retains 3GL's powerful programmability, and extends its reach into many of today's popular applications areas with 4GL approach (figuratively, "WYSIWYG programming"), making their uses easy, effective and elegant."

subsection.name: Xalan
subsection.p: "Xalan-Java is an XSLT processor for transforming XML documents into HTML, text, or other XML document types. It implements the W3C Recommendations for XSL Transformations (XSLT) and the XML Path Language (XPath). It can be used from the command line, in an applet or a servlet, or as a module in other program."

tr.td: Xalan 2.2 and above (XSLT), with BSF 2.3 and above
